intro: Omphalodes hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink or purple, often with a distinctive yellow center. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Omphalodes hirsuta is known for its resilience and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
